results.title: No help wanted
results.creator_credit: Wilding Picture Productions and Orlando Lippert
results.brief_description: This film is a study of the rehabilitation of disabled American servicemen of both world wars, showing not only their training during hospitalisation, but their mastery of many jobs in industry. The film makes it clear that a handicapped veteran is not a business liability, but on the contrary is an efficient and reliable worker. The insurance companies’ attitude is an indication of the esteem in which the disabled veteran worker is held.

results.title: No going back
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: This film sensitively explores the extreme problems of social adjustment experienced by people newly released from prison. After several years of confinement within an ordered monochrome prison life, the outside world is a noisy busy place. Housing, money, wives, defactos, children, a job - all have to be sorted out within a short time if the ex-prisoner is not going to fall back on old ways, old friends, and the same situations which led to prison in the first place. Cast includes Chris Haywood, Richard Moir, Jennifer Scott-Roberts, Geraldine Smedley and Ellen Freeman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks

results.title: No frontiers for kilowatts
results.brief_description: An essential step for European cooperation has been reached in the field of energy supply. The continually changing requirements of electricity at different times of day, different seasons and weather conditions, is being supplied by power plants. With voltages up to 380,000 volts high tension wires thousands of miles long cross the frontier and provide power to all European countries.

results.title: No fixed address
results.brief_description: Follows a television reporter who becomes for a day and a night one of Melbourne’s homeless men. Shows the queue for lodging and food at the Gill Memorial Home, the City Mission, and other hostels and refuges. The reporter talks to some of these men, most of whom are unemployed - many unemployable in their present state. They tell of their daytime wandering of the streets, their difficulty in finding employment and the escape for some that alcohol brings. The problem of rehabilitation is discussed.

results.title: No fences, no boundaries: Walter Burley Griffin
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Australia Council and Tristram Miall
results.brief_description: Looks at the architect, Walter Burley Griffin’s work in Australia, with particular emphasis on his plans for the building of Canberra, Australia’s capital city. Cast: Caroline Tessandier as Marion Griffin.

results.title: No fences for Baronne: Baronne Champs libres
results.creator_credit: Jacscam Enterprises and Claude R Camredon
results.brief_description: This film describes the contrast of freedom and work for the horses in the beautiful and wild region of the Swiss Jura. It also presents exciting, unique events and popular races.

results.title: No easy answers
results.creator_credit: Michael Creedman and B F A
results.brief_description: Science is now offering society powerful tools for controlling threats to human life, health and security; but at the same time, scientists are aware that the solutions of the past were often the cause of serious new problems. This film explores the opportunities and dangers of the new scientific frontiers and examines human and environmental repercussions of current attempts to control weather.

results.title: No easy answer
results.creator_credit: Anti-Defamation League, Vassar College, Dept. of Child study and L. Joseph Stone
results.brief_description: Deals with the problem of prejudice against Jewish children. When a six-year-old Jewish girl indicates that she was involved in an antisemitic incident, her parents and their friends discuss the problem. They recall their own childhood experiences of such situations. Different approaches on the problem of protecting children from attacks are suggested. The film promotes discussion of situations involving prejudice.

results.title: No dedication (no education)
results.brief_description: This film is part documentary and part music video. On Sunday 17th April 2005, Johnny Mac, a Koorie MC from Melbourne, performed at an outdoor concert and BBQ for 40 odd kids and their parents at the Ballarat Aboriginal Cooperative. The theme of the song and the day was education and the kids captured footage of the show and interviewed their parents and Elders about their school days.
